t: More brands are leaving Amazon, but the strategy could backfire
s: January 27, 2020 - This week, Ikea said it would be moving away from Amazon, joining a growing list of brands who have ended business with the site. The moves have sparked fears about who might leave Amazon next, and whether or not Amazon will suffer as a result.

t: Amazon brand registration failed, lawyer is not the issue!
s: I recently encountered a problem while registering my brand on Amazon and I hope to get some help here. Amazon sent me an email telling me that there was a problem with my trademark's agent lawyer, but my lawyer is not aware of any issue.

t: How Do I Check If a Brand Name Is In Use on Amazon?
s: I did not register the brand. My listing was approved and I created the labels to ship product to Amazon. Then I got an email from Amazon stating I was in violation of policy because I listed a brand name that was already in use on Amazon. My first thought was: why did Amazon approve my brand name to begin with. My product is named after a small US city. I explained this in my reply but ...

t: Should Your Company Sell on Amazon?
s: September 1, 2022 - Selling on Amazon allows brands to reach millions of consumers—but that exposure comes with costs. t: Why do some products on Amazon look the same but have different brand names? - Quora
s: Answer: This is simple to answer. They look similar because the different brands are using the same supplier. This is ok but I suspect they are taking a generic product (like skin cream or headphones) but are not doing any modifications beyond putting their brand name on the product and packaging...
